metadata.feature_description: Option to hide the Windows authentication login button from the login page

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Hide Login Controls setting is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Extensions > Authentication Systems > Active Directory > Site Settings
steps.expected: Hide Login Controls checkbox should be visible in the settings form
steps.actual: Hide Login Controls checkbox is visible and accessible in the Site Settings tab

steps.action: Click on the Hide Login Controls checkbox to enable it
Click Update Authentication Settings to save the configuration
steps.expected: Settings should be saved and page should refresh with status message
steps.actual: Settings were saved successfully. Page refreshed showing LDAP status messages (expected without AD) and checkbox remained checked

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable Hide Login Controls option (restore original state)

steps.action: Click on the Hide Login Controls checkbox to disable it
Click Update Authentication Settings to save the configuration
steps.actual: Settings were saved successfully and checkbox remained unchecked

observations: The LDAP connection status messages (FAIL) displayed after saving are expected behavior since no Active Directory is configured in the test environment

The 'Hide Login Controls' setting works in conjunction with 'Enabled' (Windows Authentication) - when Hide Login Controls is checked, Enabled is automatically checked as well per code logic in Settings.ascx.cs lines 294-297
Code review confirms the setting is stored as 'AD_HideWindowsLogin' in portal settings and controls visibility of the Windows Login tab on the login page
